reviews.review_msg: Lectures felt a bit unorganized and strayed far from the textbook, even though the quizzes were based a lot on textbook information. Written assignments had unclear guidelines but he was accessible outside of class for questions. As a person he is very caring and funny, but I would not take another class with him.

I've spent 4 years at SFU so far and never once felt THIS compelled to write a review for any professor-- if you're lucky enough to get Bert as a professor or TA, do it. Bert is the funniest, kindest, and most respectful faculty member I've interacted with throughout my entire undergrad. Treated everyone like equals, no prof/student inequality.

BERT IS INCREDIBLE! I've never had a prof so dedicated, passionate, and supportive. He takes time to explain, encourages questions, and makes every class exciting. He truly wants his students to succeed, and it shows. I still think about what I learned from the course to this day. Take any class with him if you get the chance!

Took 308 with Sager, and overall it was a decent course, not too difficult but challenging all the same. Real trouble started because he would encourage students to reach out if help was needed for the final paper but then email back saying he was "too busy" to go over materials. Don't offer then?? lmao

It's been a refreshing experiencing learning from Bertrand. He is a fantastic instructor who really cares about his students and the quality of their education. If you get the chance to take one of his courses or tutorials take it!

He is a very good prof! I'd say his TA marked a bit hard, I got 70% on my first part of the assignment he gives but I followed all the guidelines. Other than that, he is super easy to reach, literally treats you as an equal, and will always go out of his way to assist you outside of class if you need it.

Bert was a great prof. His lectures are quite amusing despite the bland topic of this course-- he makes it enjoyable. Lots of readings, but the quizzes are open-book online so it's not that bad. He is very to the point and doesn't deal with BS, so his emails can come off short, but he response within like 5-30mins from sending. I recommend.

Mr. Sager was the best professor I've had in my four years at SFU by FAR. He is kind, funny, friendly, and an open-minded guy. Unlike many other profs, he seems like he sees his students as equals rather than inferiors to him, & he tries to be as unbiased as possible when teaching abt certain subjects. I reallyyy hope I get him again!!!

Bert is a lovely person and professor. He cares about teaching a quality course and is really engaged with the material. I was dreading taking this course as I did not originally want to take it but he made it enjoyable!

Took PSYC 308 (not in the option to choose). He's a good storyteller, does go off topic but somehow manages to get through all stuff and even finish class early. Though I personally suck at history whatsoever, his way of talking/teaching made the materials sound extra interesting, lectures were fun, the whole semester with him was amazing.
Bert was an amazing prof for PSYC 308. His lectures are entertaining and the assignments are interesting to do.

Bert is a phenomenal TA. He was extremely accessible, compassionate, and witty. He always took time to check in with his students, was reasonable with assignment grading, and took additional time to go over questions before submitting. He always vouched for his students and pushed me to succeed far beyond what I thought was capable.

Bert was my TA for psyc 210 and was incredible. He was very compassionate, not at all condescending, and never made anyone in class feel dumb. Online accessibility was no problem as he was willing to meet whenever worked best for the student, despite him having other responsibilities. I would take a class or tutorial again with him in a heartbeat.

Funny guy. No textbook. Lectures can get confusing. Need to spend extra time self studying. HW and exams include stuff that doesnt get taught in class. First time actually teaching the class, but I would not take a class with him again. Goes off topic easily. But again, super funny dude. Makes lecture enjoyable-even thoguh i dont learn anything.

Bert wasn't my professor. He was my TA for 210. 
I would recommend everyone to take a class with him if they have the opportunity. What an interesting person he is. He grades fairly and makes tough course material seem more approachable. He really prepares you for the exam as well.

Was an extremely hard marker. After doing bad on the first take home exam, I got no comments on where I went wrong or where to improve (the other TAs did) so I had to set up a zoom meeting. He met with me and made me feel like crap but I had an idea of where to improve for next time. He graded me worse on the second exam. Avoid him as a TA.
Bert is my TA for 210, he's very open to feedback if the way he's explaining things isn't working for you, very engaging and talks to students as equals. I'd take more courses with him if I could.
Didn't have him as a prof but as a TA for 210 and thought I should put it out there that he is the best TA I've ever had, he may be eccentric but is the most caring TA ever.

Bert is definitely a character, super funny and sarcastic but very relatable. He is so knowledgeable about a variety of topics and is always open to talking to students. His lectures use examples that show up on the tests so it's helpful to attend. If you're ever confused, I definitely recommend going to him for extra help, he genuinely cares!
One of my favorite professors! He is a funny guy and his session is so informative! If you need help to write your paper, you should definitely go to him for advice :)

There is a paper which honestly wouldn't have been two bad if he actually had explained what his expectations on it were... but sadly he did not. His comments/feedback he gives is very sarcastic almost making you feel like an idiot. Lectures are very long and boring. He talks way to fast.

Absolutely loved this prof, highly recommend! His lectures are super interesting and he's super silly and #relatable. I personally studied off the textbook a lot but his lectures helped immensely with the cramming session. His exams are super straightforward and it's honestly an easy A course. This was my first easy A+!

definitely one of my favourite professors ever. he's hilarious and makes lecture very entertaining. his exams are really good - no trick questions, just tests your understanding of the material. very friendly and he will willingly spend hours with you if you need help (provided there are no students waiting). wish he taught more psyc courses!
He is nice and friendly. But he speaks too fast and refuse to use a mic. It is hard for non-native speaker to understand what he said.

Best prof I've ever had. Interesting, hilarious, and truly cares about his students. The class was at 830 am but I didn't miss a single one simply because he made lectures so fun. He makes every concept easily understandable. His tests are fair and show your knowledge, he doesn't try to trick his students. Wish he could be my prof for every course.

Awesome prof! Tests were all multiple choice and very fair. However, the criteria for the paper was a bit unclear, and the class average for it was 58%. Make sure you talk to your TA to clarify and ask questions!

The best prof I ever had, enjoyed each one and every class. He is a funny guy so lectures aren't boring, the entire class would be there every week even though participation is not mandatory. Had amazing time and would take all my classes with this prof until I graduate if such thing was possible!

Bert is hilarious. Seriously one of the BEST prof's I've EVER had at SFU. Even though this is his first time teaching a class he was awesome. For an 8:30 class I really enjoyed myself and always felt engaged. He was so funny and always kept the class entertained, even when the material was a bit dry. One of the best classes I have ever taken!

Bert was a great professor. He was funny and kept the class engaged 8:30 classes on possibly the driest topic in psychology. It was his first semester teaching the course and I can say that he didn't let any of us down. He could've been a bit more specific for the paper but other than that his exams ere very fair as long as you also read the text.

Bert is a real gem. I rarely go to 3 hour lectures especially those at 8:30am but his lectures were really interesting. He explains concepts so that they really do make sense and you can connect them to the real world. His tests were more than fair, all you really have to do is read the textbook. 100% would take a class with him again.

Bert is an amazing lecturer; he's always super engaged (even though class was at 8:30am) and you can tell he really cares about his students. Accessible office hours all around, and has a fun personality. Would definitely take a class with him again.

Overall, he was a great, chill, funny prof. Definitely made dry material more interesting. He made midterms fair and they allowed you to show your understanding for sure. I wish he was more clear about his assignment (it was marked quite harshly), but other than that no complains! Definitely take his class!!(was also really nice to late students :)

Professor Sager is the best professor Ive ever had. I hate morning classes and yet I always showed up to his 8:30 class because hes really good at explaining hard material in an easy fun way. His exams are pretty easy if you do the readings and review his slides. Hes very organized and you get tested on the material covered in the slides.

Bert is the most engaging prof I have had at SFU so far. He makes jokes throughout the class which keep you interested, and mentions all the important details needed for the exam. His exams are all multiple choice, and the lectures are sufficient enough to get a good grade in them.

Bert is probably the funniest and most interesting psychology professor I have taken thus far- such an awesome prof I wanted to make this review! He makes difficult content fun and easy to understand. His charisma and genuine interest in psychology really show in each lecture and makes the learning experience in his class sincerely enjoyable.

BERT IS AMAZING!! He loves to crack jokes and is super corky which is great for an early morning class. His slides are literally a condensed version of the textbook. Otherwise, I honestly wouldn't go to most classes if it wasn't for him himself - along with the participation assignments.

Bert is funny which helped make class really interesting, and did lots of demos to help students understand what he was talking about. Easy assignments are due in class every class, and demos and extra info aren't on the slides he gives you, so going to every class is a good idea.
